title: The Block's Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie break their silence on huge backlash
text:
The Block fans have turned on Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie in recent episodes over their shocking comments and behaviour on the Nine renovation show.

And as the stylish grandfathers become the program's biggest 'villains' this year, they have spoken out about the growing backlash against them.

'We feel pretty secure in ourselves and really don't give much attention to them,' the pair told Woman's Day of the negative comments from viewers.

Backlash: The Block fans have turned on Mitch Edwards (L) and Mark McKie (R) in recent episodes over their shocking comments and behaviour on the Nine renovation show

The Bondi couple added: 'There are of course trolls who like to hide behind a keyboard and say things.'

Last week, Mitch stunned fans by screaming at co-star Tess Struber as the rivals clashed over the plans for their neighbouring renovations.

After they were denied a spa, Mitch screamed: 'You f*** with us, I f*** with you.'

Speaking out: 'We feel pretty secure in ourselves and really don't give much attention to them,' the pair told Woman's Day on Monday of negative comments from viewers

Outrage: Last week, Mitch stunned fans by screaming at co-star Tess Struber (pictured) as the rivals clashed over the plans for their neighbouring renovations

The controversial couple also came under fire for listing their townhouse as a 'four bedroom property' - despite it only having three bedrooms.

During an early challenge on the show, Mitch and Mark decided to convert their fourth bedroom into an additional entertaining space.

At the time, the controversial move was praised by the judges.

Outburst: After they were denied a spa, Mitch screamed, 'You f*** with us, I f*** with you'

'I loved them at the start but their b****iness is beyond a joke. Can't stand them any more,' vented one fan on Facebook last week.

'Mitch and Mark didn't have to be so rude when they were confronted,' said another.

A third viewer wrote: 'Their attitude has become immature and spiteful.'

The Block continues on Monday night at 7:30pm on Nine
